attributes.action: Hold a by-election whenever a sitting MP changes political party.
attributes.additional_details: An MP voted in on a particular manifesto/political party who then goes on to change their allegiance to another party is no longer representative of the voters in their constituency.
attributes.background: People vote for an MP because they believe in a particular political party or manifesto, if that  MP then changes their party they should stand again in a by-election. This would ensure that the voters are represented by the party they want rather than by the whim of a particular MP.

rejection.details:
By-elections to be called automatically when MPs defect to another party
